channel.title: CVE Feed for KNIME -- KNIME Business Hub
channel.description: The latest CVEs for KNIME -- KNIME Business Hub

item.title: CVE-2023-3140|2023-06-07T09:15:00.112Z -- knime -- knime%20business%20hub
item.description: Missing HTTP headers (X-Frame-Options, Content-Security-Policy) in KNIME Business Hub before 1.4.0 has left users vulnerable to click jacking. Clickjacking is an attack that occurs when an attacker uses a transparent iframe in a window to trick a user into clicking on an actionable item, such as a button or link, to another server in which they have an identical webpage. The attacker essentially hijacks the user activity intended for the original server and sends them to the other server.

item.title: CVE-2023-2541|2023-06-07T08:08:50.258Z -- knime -- knime%20business%20hub
item.description: The Web Frontend of KNIME Business Hub before 1.4.0 allows an unauthenticated remote attacker to access internals about the application such as versions, host names, or IP addresses. No personal information or application data was exposed.
